confSmallWindow.description: Running Task Timer in a small window - use icons?
confSmallWindow.message:
You seem to be running Task Timer in a small window, small monitor, or at a low resolution. Would you like to switch to icons instead of buttons in the task list? This will help make sure that tasks don't take up more than one line each.

This setting can also be changed in the tools menu.

errAlreadyOpen.message:
The app is already open.
If this appears to be incorrect, press the reload button below. Task Timer will be reloaded as if you closed Chrome.

infoData.description: Reminder that the data is only saved locally
infoData.message:
Note: This only saves locally, on your computer, in your browser.
Don't worry, your tasks will **not** be deleted if you clear Chrome's cache/storage.

infoPerformance.message:
Is the app running slowly for you? Try increasing the pie chart update time in the settings, or disabling pie charts completely.
Still running slowly? Increase the general update time or disable task history tracking.

infoSettings.description: Reminder to check out the settings menu
infoSettings.message:
Make sure to check out the settings by clicking on the gear button in the top right corner of the app!
There are settings such as desktop notifications for when a task finishes.

infoTotals.message:
This is the totals row. It only appears when you have more than one task.

The "Time Spent" column of this row totals the time spent on every single one of your tasks.
The "Goal" column of this row totals all of the goal times from all of your tasks, other than indefinite ones.
The "Progress" column of this row gives you the total progress towards finishing the goals of all of your tasks. This progress does not include time spent that went over a task's goal, or time spent on tasks with indefinite goals.

infoTranslate.message: Want to help translate Task Timer to other languages? Click [here].

noteNoLocalFiles.message:
It looks like you're using a path to a local file on your machine for the custom sound URL.
Unfortunately, local files cannot be used, as Chrome does not allow access to your local filesystem, even for a sound.
Only internet URLs (beginning with http, https, or ftp) can be used. This means that you need to find a sound online, or upload the sound that you want somewhere.

noteNotifsWorkBody.message: You seeing this means desktop notifications are enabled and working correctly! Woo!
